comments: From Brackett spectrum of hydrogen. Wavelengths in hydrogen spectrum are given by Rydberg's formula 1/wavelength = constant*(1/m^2 - 1/n^2).a(4*n+2) =5,21,45,... =A078371. Also A061037(2*n+1). [_Paul Curtz_, Oct 05 2008]
references: J. E. Brady and G. E. Humiston, General Chemistry, 3rd. ed., Wiley; p. 78.
Frederick Sumner Brackett(1896-1988): Visible and Infra-Red Radiation of Hydrogen, Astrophysical Journal, 56, No. 3 (1922) pp. 154-161, not seen. [From Paul Curtz, Oct 05 2008]
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..10000
J. J. O'Connor and E. F. Robertson, Johannes Robert Rydberg
Eric Weisstein's World of Physics, Balmer Formula
formula: a(n) = 3*a(n-8) - 6*a(n-16) + 10*a(n-24) - 12*a(n-32) + 12*a(n-40) - 10*a(n-48) + 6*a(n-56) - 3*a(n-64) + a(n-72). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011a(n) = (n^2-16) / gcd(16*n^2, n^2-16). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 25 2011, corrected by _Colin Barker_, Jan 13 2014.
prog: (PARI) a(n)=numerator(1/16-1/n^2) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011(Haskell)import Data.Ratio ((%), numerator)a061041 n = numerator (1%16 - 1%n^2)  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 30 2012
crossrefs: Cf. A064038. [From Jaume Oliver Lafont, Nov 28 2009]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 26 2001
